channel.title: Help
channel.description: ok, this prbly sounds really noobish but how can i find the right path to my jdk so i can compile??

item.description:
@JoshB wrote:

Ok go to … My Computer - LocalDisk (D) or © or whatever - Program Files - Java post when the url bar looks like.

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Nubz Nubz
item.description:
@Nubz wrote:

Well go to your compiler…
Fuck it try this if it doesn’t work pm me and ill help you.
I’m not going to bother typing this to everyone else so if this path doesn’t work, I will help you if you pm me. I’m also going to say, computers have different compiling paths, all are not the same. You probably figured that out by now though Lol.

@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit

Read full topic
